Me personally? Not that regularly; h=
owever, I can see where some people might like to set that condition. But, =
my Java work so far has always been in the sub-75k-line range so I am not w=
orking on the large programs. In my C++ experience, I have had is-a relatio=
nships at 10+ depth with these conditions sitting throughout. So, I can ima=
gine that people working on very large Java programs might run into the sam=
e thing.

Actually, I am thinking that the unit test only needs to identify=
 those relationships that are linked. Thus the vast majority of tests would=
 run regardless, but when they saw a relationship is linked it knows not to=
 run the test when the first test failed. If the programmer begins to link =
too much then they are using a unit tool to test integration - something th=
at it is not meant to do.
